thread.title: Justin Fontaine taken to hospital after ARCA crash at Daytona

author: USA TODAY Sports
title: Justin Fontaine taken to hospital after ARCA crash at Daytona
text:

Justin Fontaine goes on his lid with 5 laps left to go! #ARCAonFS1 https://t.co/ZHNRq1FQum Heather Tucker , USA TODAY Sports 7:42 p.m. ET Feb. 18, 2017 Justin Fontaine flips upside down following a multi-car crash in Saturday's ARCA race at Daytona International Speedway. (Photo: John David Mercer, USA TODAY Sports) CONNECT COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
DAYTONA BEACH, Fla. -- Justin Fontaine was taken to a hospital after a crash in the closing laps of the ARCA race at Daytona International Speedway on Saturday. 
Fontaine was involved in a three-car crash with five laps remaining in the season opener for the Automobile Racing Club of America. 
His car hit the outside wall — covered by a SAFER barrier — and flipped onto its lid as the cars skidded down the frontstretch. His car remained upside down as it slid down the apron. Safety crews, after determining Fontaine was responsive, flipped the car and had to cut the roof to extricate him. 
Fontaine, 19, of Fletcher, N.C., was making his first ARCA start. 
The race was called due to time constraints and the need for repairs to the SAFER barrier. 
Austin Theriault, who was running first at the time of the crash, was declared the winner. Terry Jones finished second, followed by Shane Lee, Dalton Sargeant and pole-sitter Tom Hessert. Theriault passed Jones for the lead with eight laps to go. 
The Monster Energy NASCAR Cup Series is slated to open tonight with the Advance Auto Parts Clash. 
Follow Tucker on Twitter @HeatherR_Tucker 
Safety crews transport Justin Fontaine after he was extricated from his car, which had flipped upside down.
